concept.title: Directory Templates
concept.shortdesc: The Hadoop FS destination uses directory templates to create output and late record directories. Hadoop FS writes records to the directories based on the configured time basis.

conbody.p: Hadoop FS destinationdirectory templatesdirectory templatesHadoop FSYou can use a mix of constants, field values, and datetime variables in a directory template.

You can use the following elements in a directory template:
Constants You can use any constant, such as "output" or "lateRecords."
Field Values You can call a field in an expression: ${record:value("/<field name>")}.
Datetime Variables Hadoop FS creates directories as needed, based on the smallest datetime variable that you use. For example, if the smallest variable is hours, then the directories are created for every hour of the day that receives output records. You can use the following datetime variables in a directory template:
${YYYY} - four digit year
${YY} - two digit year
${MM} - two digit month
${DD} - two digit date
${hh} - two digit hour
${mm} - two digit minute
${ss} - two digit second
When you define a directory template, use all of the datetime variables between one of the year variables and the smallest variable that you want to use. For example, to create directories on a daily basis, you might use one of the following datetime variable progressions:
${YYYY}-${MM}-${DD} ${YY}_${MM}_${DD}
